document_title: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: Causes, signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Doctor Huynh Ngoc Long said that hypertrophic cardiomyopathy is a genetic disease caused by gene mutations, so there is no effective prevention measure. It is important to identify the condition as early as possible to receive timely treatment and prevent complications.
If a family member has the disease, it is recommended that the remaining members have regular health checks so that the disease can be detected early.
“The signs of cardiovascular disease are very vague, easily confused with other diseases. Therefore, in many cases, patients discover the disease when it has progressed seriously, or it is accidentally discovered when examining another disease. Besides, almost 100% of older people can suffer from many diseases at the same time such as hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, hypertension, diabetes, etc. If not detected early and treated promptly, it can lead to complications. dangerous, even life-threatening symptoms," Dr. Huynh Ngoc Long emphasized.
Therefore, Dr. Huynh Ngoc Long recommends that regardless of age, especially sports players and people with underlying medical conditions, they need to have regular cardiovascular health examinations and screenings to detect early and effectively treat cardiovascular diseases. cardiovascular problems.
To schedule an examination and screening for hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and cardiovascular diseases at Tam Anh General Hospital System through information channels: TAM ANH GENERAL HOSPITAL SYSTEM Hanoi: 108 Hoang Nhu Tiep, Ward. Bo De, Long Bien District, Hanoi City Hotline: 024 3872 3872 – 024 7106 6858 Ho Chi Minh City: 2B Pho Quang, Ward 2, Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh City Hotline: 0287 102 6789 – 093 180 6858 Fanpage: https://www.facebook.com/benhvientamanh Website: https://tamanhhospital.vn
Hopefully the above information will help you gain more knowledge about hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. Note, medical information is for reference only and is not a substitute for examination, diagnosis and treatment by a cardiologist. Therefore, when your body shows unusual signs, you should go to the hospital immediately for examination, accurate diagnosis, and appropriate treatment!
